conclusion: Draw the forces acting on the suitcase: weight, normal reaction, pulling force, and kinetic friction.
The suitcase moves at constant velocity, so the net force in every direction is zero.
Vertical equilibrium equation: N = mg - F sin θ.
Horizontal equilibrium equation: F cos θ = μN.
Insert vertical equilibrium into horizontal equilibrium: F cos θ = μ(mg - F sin θ).
Collect F-terms: F (cos θ + μ sin θ) = μmg.
Expression for pull required: F(θ) = μmg / (cos θ + μ sin θ).
Find angle that minimizes F(θ): Differentiate D(θ) and set to zero, tan θ = μ.
Express minimum pull: F_min = μmg / √(1 + μ²).
Use given F_min = 90 N to determine μ: μ = 0.75.
Find corresponding angle θ: θ = arctan(3/4) ≈ 37°.
Numerical check with sin 37° = 0.6 is consistent.
Final answer: Coefficient of kinetic friction μ = 0.75, angle θ ≈ 37°.
